com.lambda
Class Game

java.lang.Object
  com.lambda.Game

public abstract class Game
extends java.lang.Object

The 'Game' class contains methods every 'Game' needs to have in order to work properly with the engine.

Author:
alex

Constructor Summary
Game()
           
 
Method Summary
 int getActiveState()
          Gives back the ID of the currently active 'GameState'.
 void init()
          Initializes all objects the 'Game' needs to work properly.
 void registerState(GameState state, int id)
          Registers the 'GameState' 'state' with the ID 'id', so it can be used by the 'Game'.
 void removeState(int id)
          Removes the 'GameState' specified by the ID 'id' from the list of registered 'GameStates' so it is not usable anymore.
 void render()
          Calls the 'render()'-method for the currently active 'GameState'.
 void switchState(int id)
          Switches the current 'GameState' to another 'GameState' that is currently registered.

          Calls the 'update()'-method for the currently active 'GameState'.

Constructor Detail

Game

public Game()
Method Detail

init

public void init()
Initializes all objects the 'Game' needs to work properly.

render

public void render()
Calls the 'render()'-method for the currently active 'GameState'. This will only work if there is actually 1 or more 'GameStates' registered.

update

public void update(int delta)
Calls the 'update()'-method for the currently active 'GameState'. This will only work if there is actually 1 or more 'GameStates' registered.

Parameters:
delta - The time that has passed between the looping of two frames.

registerState

public void registerState(GameState state,
                          int id)
Registers the 'GameState' 'state' with the ID 'id', so it can be used by the 'Game'. This will only work if the 'GameState' is not 'null' and if the ID 'id' is non-existent within the already registered 'GameStates'.

Parameters:
state - The 'GameState' to register for the 'Game'.
id - The ID the newly registered 'GameState' is going to have.

switchState

public void switchState(int id)
Switches the current 'GameState' to another 'GameState' that is currently registered. This will only work if the 'GameState' with the ID 'id' actually exists and is registered.

Parameters:
id - The ID of the 'GameState' to switch to.

removeState

public void removeState(int id)
Removes the 'GameState' specified by the ID 'id' from the list of registered 'GameStates' so it is not usable anymore. This will only work, if the 'GameState' exists and is registered.

Parameters:
id - The ID of the 'GameState' to remove.

getActiveState

public int getActiveState()
Gives back the ID of the currently active 'GameState'.

Returns:
The ID of the currently active 'GameState'.
